1.text: Melt the unsalted butter in a saucepan over low-heat.

2.text: Stir 1 tablespoon (15 mL) of the melted butter into the cold milk.

3.text: Pour the milk into the rest of the butter and cook it over low-heat.

4.text: Mix the cream until it thickens.

5.text: Keep the cream in the fridge and use it within 1 week.

6.text: Combine water and unflavored gelatin, then wait 5 minutes.

7.text: Cook the mixture over low-heat until it turns clear, stirring often.

8.text: Let the mixture cool, then whisk it into whole milk for a few seconds.

9.text: Whisk in the powdered sugar and vanilla extract.

10.text: Refrigerate the mixture for about 90 minutes, stirring it every 15 minutes.

11.text: Whip the mixture with a hand-held mixer until it turns creamy.

12.text: Store the whipped cream in the fridge for up to 2 days.

13.text: Pour the non-homogenized milk into a glass jar.

14.text: Let fresh milk rest for 24 hours.

15.text: Find the line where the milk and cream separate.

16.text: Dip a ladle into the cream, above the cream line.

17.text: Scoop the cream out and transfer it into a separate container.

18.text: Repeat the process until you have about 1 inch (2.5 cm) of cream left.

19.text: Use the separated milk and cream as desired.
